conclusion: Analyze the given velocity-time graphs for both cars to determine the maximum distance between Car A and Car B.
At t = 10 s, Car A is at v = 0 m/s.
At t = 20 s, Car A is at v = 40 m/s.
At t = 30 s, Car A is at v = 40 m/s.
At t = 10 s, Car B is at v = 0 m/s.
At t = 20 s, Car B is at v = 0 m/s.
At t = 30 s, Car B is at v = 0 m/s.
The maximum distance between Car A and Car B occurs when they are side by side at t = 30 s.
At t = 30 s, Car A is at v = 40 m/s and Car B is at v = 0 m/s.
The maximum distance between them is the horizontal distance between their positions at t = 30 s.
The horizontal distance between Car A and Car B at t = 30 s is 40 m.
The maximum distance between Car A and Car B between the two instances when they are side by side is 40 m.
